Colours

The Brand colours are the main colours for the OncoTherics and BioSuspension sites. The Alt colours are the main colour for the BioTherics website.

Brand

$col-brand

#278b94

Brand CTA

$col-brand-cta

#154b50

Alt

$col-alt

#be582c

Alt CTA

$col-alt-cta

#da7a13

Text

$col-text

#4a4a4a

Page

$col-page

#fff

Border

$col-border

#b7b3b3

Typography

The main typeface is Encode Sans
It is available from Google Fonts and served from there to the website.
Line height is 1.5 for body text and 1.2 for headings. Maximum line length is 660px or 75 characters.

Level one heading

Level two heading

Level three heading

Level four heading

This is a paragraph of text. Some of the text may be emphasised and some it might even be strongly emphasised.

Occasionally quoted text may be found within a paragraph …and of course a link may appear at any point in the text. The average paragraph contains five or six sentences although some may contain as little or one or two while others carry on for anything up to ten sentences and beyond.

View example code ⤳ 
<h1>Level one heading</h1>
<h2>Level two heading</h2>
<h3>Level three heading</h3>
<h4>Level four heading</h4>
<p>This is a paragraph of text. Some of the text may be <em>emphasised</em> and some it might even be <strong>strongly emphasised</strong>.</p>
<p>Occasionally <q>quoted text</q> may be found within a paragraph &hellip;and of course <a href="#">a link</a> may appear at any point in the text. The average paragraph contains five or six sentences although some may contain as little or one or two while others carry on for anything up to ten sentences and beyond.</p>

Ordered List

  1. First list item
  2. Second item in a list of ordered items
  3. Third item in the list
View example code ⤳ 
<ol>
<li>First list item</li>
<li>Second item in a list of ordered items</li>
<li>Third item in the list</li>
</ol>

Unordered List

  • A list item
  • Another item in a list
  • Yet another item in this list of items
View example code ⤳ 
<ul>
<li>A list item</li>
<li>Another item in a list</li>
<li>Yet another item in this list of items</li>
</ul>

Links

A sentence with an inline link in between all the other words.

View example code ⤳ 
<p>A sentence with an inline <a href="">link</a> in between all the other words.</p>

Buttons

Link as button

Link as button

Link as button

Link as button
View example code ⤳ 
<!-- Standard brand buttons -->
<button class="button--standard">Button</button>
<a class="button--standard" href="">Link as button</a>
<input class="button--standard" type="submit" value="Form submit">
<br><br>
<!-- Standard brand buttons on a call-to-action form -->
<button class="button--standard--cta">Button</button>
<a class="button--standard--cta" href="">Link as button</a>
<input class="button--standard--cta" type="submit" value="Form submit">
<br><br>
<!-- Standard alt buttons -->
<button class="button--alt">Button</button>
<a class="button--alt" href="">Link as button</a>
<input class="button--alt" type="submit" value="Form submit">
<br><br>
<!-- Standard alt buttons on a call-to-action form -->
<button class="button--alt--cta">Button</button>
<a class="button--alt--cta" href="">Link as button</a>
<input class="button--alt--cta" type="submit" value="Form submit">

Form Fields

Form Field Validation

→ Your .. is required to send the form

→ Your email address is required to send the form

→ A message is required to send the form

Tables with lines

Fruit Type Dried Seedless Dry colour
Raisin white ✓ ✗ dark
Sultana white ✓ ✓ golden
Currant black ✓ ✓ dark
View example code ⤳ 
<table class="table--plain">
	<thead>
		<tr>
			<th>Fruit</th>
			<th>Type</th>
			<th>Dried</th>
			<th>Seedless</th>
			<th>Dry colour</th>
		</tr>
	</thead>
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td>Raisin</td>
			<td>white</td>
			<td>&check;</td>
			<td>&cross;</td>
			<td>dark</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>Sultana</td>
			<td>white</td>
			<td>&check;</td>
			<td>&check;</td>
			<td>golden</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>Currant</td>
			<td>black</td>
			<td>&check;</td>
			<td>&check;</td>
			<td>dark</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table>

Tables with stripes

Fruit Type Dried Seedless Dry colour
Raisin white ✓ ✗ dark
Sultana white ✓ ✓ golden
Currant black ✓ ✓ dark
View example code ⤳ 
<table class="table--stripes">
	<thead>
		<tr>
			<th>Fruit</th>
			<th>Type</th>
			<th>Dried</th>
			<th>Seedless</th>
			<th>Dry colour</th>
		</tr>
	</thead>
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td>Raisin</td>
			<td>white</td>
			<td>&check;</td>
			<td>&cross;</td>
			<td>dark</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>Sultana</td>
			<td>white</td>
			<td>&check;</td>
			<td>&check;</td>
			<td>golden</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>Currant</td>
			<td>black</td>
			<td>&check;</td>
			<td>&check;</td>
			<td>dark</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table>
